summary: Website for live streaming from a single authorized broadcaster to viewers with code-based access (fixed session code), featuring a football-themed UI with real-time game/event controls plus an on-camera (over-video) bottom scoreboard overlay on both broadcaster and viewer views, including team icons/scores and a small "VillanSpoon" label in the scoreboard corner.
architectural_notes: Add a 'single-broadcaster' rule: only the owner can create/start the live session; viewers are view-only.
Support a fixed session code ('pinedo') for the primary broadcast flow (no code generation needed for this mode).
Render scoreboard UI as an overlay on the video element/stream (bottom of camera) for both broadcaster preview and viewer playback; remove the separate bottom-of-screen scorebar UI.
Flag events should render as a temporary on-video overlay (team + reason) visible to both broadcaster and viewers.
Score updates should be set via manual entry controls (no +1 point button) and persisted so viewers see updates.
known_issues: Previous build attempt failed with: "AI was unable to complete your request."

existing_features.title: Create a football-themed UI and layout used consistently across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and components) with a distinct style appropriate for a live football broadcast control room.
Implement a viewer access gate where viewers must enter a valid session code before they can watch a live broadcast.
Implement a broadcaster (mobile-friendly) page that can capture live video/audio from the phone camera/microphone and start/stop a live session associated with a shareable session code.
Implement live streaming delivery from broadcaster to viewers using an in-browser real-time protocol with backend-assisted session signaling and state (no third-party streaming providers).

Add a football control panel for the broadcaster with clearly labeled buttons for common game events (at minimum: Flag and Point/Score), and publish these events to viewers in real time (e.g., as an on-screen overlay and/or an event feed).
Create frontend pages and navigation for (1) Broadcaster mode and (2) Viewer mode, optimized for mobile use on the broadcaster side and simple viewing on the viewer side.
Add basic safety/validation states: missing permissions, unsupported browser features, and session lifecycle states (not started, live, ended).
Render generated image assets (football-themed background and simple UI icons) from static files under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI.

Render a fixed bottom-of-screen scorebar on the Viewer Watch page that displays both teams’ selected icons and current scores, and ensure it remains visible while watching (sticky footer-style overlay that does not block core controls).

Add broadcaster UI controls to set each team’s icon (restricted to exactly: dolphin, bullfrog, fist, tornado) and to adjust each team’s score during a live session; persist changes to the backend so viewers see updates.
Use generated static image assets for the four allowed team icons and display them in the icon selection UI and in the bottom scorebar.
Replace the Viewer Watch page’s fixed bottom-of-screen scorebar with an on-camera (over-video) bottom scoreboard overlay rendered inside the video container, visible while watching.
Add the text label "VillanSpoon" in the left corner of the on-camera scoreboard overlay on BOTH the broadcaster camera preview and the viewer stream view.
Change broadcaster score editing to manual score entry (no +/− buttons) while keeping live-updating custom scores persisted to the backend.
Remove the "Score" / point button from the broadcaster game controls so the broadcaster cannot add a point/score event via that button.

Update the broadcaster "Flag" control to require selecting which team the flag applies to and entering a reason, then publish that flag announcement so it appears as an on-camera overlay over the video (visible to both broadcaster and viewers).
Ensure the viewer’s latest-event presentation is on-camera (over-video) rather than a separate card below the video when an event arrives (especially flags).

new_feature_requests.summary: Mobile live video capture and streaming to a web audience
Viewer access control via entry code (only users with a code can watch)
Football-themed UI with event buttons to record game actions (e.g., flags, points)
Persist session metadata and event logs in the backend so that viewers who join mid-stream can immediately see the current session state and recent events after joining with the code.
Support a single shared broadcast/session with a fixed viewer access code (“pinedo”)
Restrict broadcasting to the owner/only one broadcaster can start the session
Allow selecting team icons only from a limited set (dolphin, bullfrog, fist, tornado)
Add persistent per-session scoreboard state that includes (a) two team scores and (b) each team’s selected icon, and expose backend methods to update and fetch this scoreboard state by session code.
Replace the bottom-of-screen scorebar with an on-camera (over-video) bottom scoreboard overlay visible to both broadcaster and viewers
Change score controls to manual score entry (remove the +1 point button) while keeping live-updating custom scores
Show flag announcements (team + reason) as an overlay on top of the video (on-camera), visible to both broadcaster and viewers
Add a "VillanSpoon" label/watermark in the left corner of the scoreboard overlay (both broadcaster and viewer)
